author: Greg Rosenstein
description: Cleveland Browns rookie quarterback Shedeur Sanders was cited for speeding early on Tuesday, according to police records obtained by NBC News.
title: Browns QB Shedeur Sanders cited for driving 101 in 60 mph zone

description: The Buss family is selling the Los Angeles Lakers after nearly 50 years of ownership in a record-breaking $10 billion deal to Dodgers owner Mark Walter. NBA legend Magic Johnson, a part-owner of the Dodgers, praised the sale, calling it a win for Lakers fans worldwide.
title: Lakers sold in record $10B deal to Dodgers owner

author: Angela Yang
description: After decades of performing for one of the NFL’s most valuable franchises while earning less-than-glamorous wages, the Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders have secured a 400% pay raise
title: Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders successfully lobby for a pay raise

author: The Politics Desk
description: As President Donald Trump considers whether the U.S. will strike Iran — likely the most important decision of his second term, one that could remake the landscape of the Middle East — allies and adversaries are taking sides, both at home and abroad.
title: The political tug-of-war at the center of Trump's Iran decision: From the Politics Desk

author: Andrew Greif
description: The Buss family, which has run the Lakers for 46 years, is selling a majority stake for a valuation of $10 billion.
title: Buss family selling Los Angeles Lakers: Source

author: Sahil Kapur
description: After seven Democrats voted for Noem, some say they'd now oppose her in the wake of Trump's aggressive deportation plans and last week's incident involving Sen. Alex Padilla.
title: Some Democratic senators regret voting to confirm Kristi Noem as DHS secretary

author: Kif Leswing, CNBC
description: Apple has plans to make a folding iPhone starting next year, reliable analyst Ming-Chi Kuo said on Wednesday
title: Apple looking to make 'premium' priced folding iPhones starting next year, analyst says

author: The Associated Press
description: Michigan wildlife experts finally were able to trap a black bear and remove a large lid that was stuck around his neck — for two years.
title: Michigan bear finally free of lid that was stuck on its neck for years

author: Denise Chow
description: Honda’s latest venture is taking it to new heights — literally
title: Honda says it successfully tested a resuable rocket

author: Rob Wile
description: The Federal Reserve has left its key interest rate unchanged for its fourth-straight meeting
title: Why the Federal Reserve is keeping interest rates elevated for now

author: Ben Goggin
description: When Elon Musk took over Twitter in 2022, he said that addressing the problem of child sexual abuse material on the platform was his “top priority.”
title: Accounts peddling child abuse content flood some X hashtags as safety partner cuts ties

author: Annie Nova, CNBC
description: Republicans’ “big beautiful” bill, if enacted as drafted, would make some of the biggest changes to the federal student loan system in decades
title: Three student loan changes in Republican bill: Getting out of debt would be 'extremely hard,' advocate says

author: David Ingram
description: Waymo announced plans Wednesday to bring its autonomous cars to New York City streets starting next month, but humans will be behind the steering wheel.
title: Waymo announces plan to test robotaxis in New York City with human supervision

author: Jessica Golden, CNBC
description: Kim Kardashian fans are going to have to wait a little longer for the highly anticipated NikeSKIMS line
title: Nike pushes back Skims launch with Kim Kardashian due to production delays

author: Chrissy Callahan
description: Sarah Jessica Parker knows how to brush off haters and online trolls, but she didn’t always have an easy time navigating criticism, especially about her physical appearance.
title: Sarah Jessica Parker on navigating ‘cruel’ critics of her appearance since ‘SATC’

author: Chrissy Callahan
description: Season 2 of “America’s Sweethearts: Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders” is full of highs and lows for Chandi Dayle, the longest-running veteran of the iconic squad
title: Why did Chandi Dayle leave the Dallas Cowboy Cheerleaders?

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court's ruling that upheld a Tennessee law banning certain care for transgender youth left various legal questions open even as other laws aimed at people based on gender identity, including those involving sports and military-service bans, head toward the justices.
title: Supreme Court ruling on transgender youth medical care leaves broader legal questions unresolved

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: The Trump administration will shut down the national LGBTQ youth suicide lifeline in 30 days
title: Trump administration to shut down LGBTQ youth suicide hotline

author: MacKenzie Sigalos, CNBC
description: The Justice Department announced Wednesday the largest-ever U.S. seizure of cryptocurrency linked to so-called “pig butchering” scams that have cost victims billions globally
title: DOJ seizes record $225 million in crypto tied to global 'pig butchering' scams

description: A jury has found Karen Read not guilty of second-degree murder after prosecutors retried her for the death of her boyfriend, a Boston police officer, in 2022. The jury did convict Read on a lesser charge of operating a motor vehicle while under the influence of liquor.
title: Karen Read found not guilty of murder in retrial

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: A college student who was detained by immigration authorities following a brief traffic stop earlier this month was granted bond on Wednesday, her attorney, Jon Hyman, confirmed to NBC News
title: Utah college student detained by ICE after a brief traffic stop to be released on bond

author: Denise Chow
description: A punishing heat wave in the Southwest is set to spread east in the coming days, with temperatures over 90 degrees Fahrenheit expected in the Northeast and possible record highs in parts of New England later this week.
title: Extreme heat poised to blanket much of the U.S. this week

author: Tim Stelloh
description: A jury has found Karen Read not guilty of murder in the 2022 death of her boyfriend, a Boston cop, after a hung jury last year.
title: Karen Read found not guilty of murder in retrial

author: Natasha Turak, CNBC
description: Iran is staring down the possibility of seeing its most important nuclear facilities hit by a 30,000-pound American bomb.
title: B-2 stealth bombers and 30,000-pound bunker busters: Why striking Iran’s nuclear sites is such a difficult feat

author: The Associated Press
description: The Tampa Bay Rays say they are in "exclusive discussions" with a Florida investment group for a potential sale of the team.
title: Tampa Bay Rays say they are in talks for a potential sale

author: Benjamin Ryan
description: The Food and Drug Administration has approved a highly effective new HIV-prevention medication, Gilead Sciences reported Wednesday.
title: FDA approves powerful HIV drug with the potential to end the epidemic in the U.S.

author: David K. Li
description: Police are investigating a reported overnight break-in at the boarded-up home where Minnesota state Rep.
title: Break-in reported at home of slain Minnesota state Rep. Melissa Hortman

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: A cardiac arrest was reported at celebrity chef Anne Burrell’s home on Tuesday, the New York City Fire Department said.
title: Cardiac arrest reported at Anne Burrell's home, victim found unresponsive, officials say

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Former Las Vegas Raiders wide receiver Henry Ruggs III said he wishes he could "turn back the hands of time" while speaking at an event Tuesday about his 2021 drunk driving car crash that left a woman dead.
title: Ex-Raiders receiver Henry Ruggs apologizes to family of woman he killed in car crash

author: David K. Li
description: The Florida Panthers hoisted the Stanley Cup on Tuesday night and cost a recent college grad more than $270,000 after he narrowly missed on a long shot, five-part wager that he placed one year ago.
title: Florida Panthers win Stanley Cup and cost young gambler more than $270K

author: Linda Carroll
description: A simple, though not necessarily easy, test may help predict how many years a person has left, according to a long-term study.
title: This quick, but not so easy, test can predict how long you'll live, study suggests

description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell holds a press conference after the Federal Open Market Committee meeting.
title: Fed Chair Jerome Powell speaks on interest rates

author: Marlene Lenthang
description: A North Dakota man has been charged after he allegedly emailed violent threats to a federal prosecutor and cited the weekend fatal shooting of Minnesota state Rep.
title: Man charged with threatening officials in emails that cited Minnesota shootings

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem was taken to the hospital Tuesday after she suffered an allergic reaction.
title: DHS Secretary Kristi Noem taken to hospital after an allergic reaction

author: Evan Bush
description: Each spring, billions of bogong moths fill southeast Australia’s skies.
title: Bogong moths appear to use stars to navigate 600-mile journey, a first for insects

description: The Supreme Court upheld a Tennessee law restricting gender-affirming medical care for minors. The 6-3 ruling is likely to have a broad impact as 24 other states have already enacted laws similar to the one in Tennessee, which bars gender transition surgery, puberty blockers and hormone therapy.
title: Supreme Court upholds Tennessee ban on youth gender-affirming care

author: Megan Lebowitz
description: WASHINGTON — Right-wing media personality Tucker Carlson clashed with Ted Cruz in an interview and posted a clip Tuesday night where the senator was unable to answer questions about Iran."How many people live in Iran, by the way?" Carlson asked the Texas Republican."I don't know the population," Cruz responded."At all?" Carlson asked, prompting Cruz to reiterate that he did not know.
title: Tucker Carlson clashes with Sen. Ted Cruz: 'You don't know anything about Iran'

author: Chloe Atkins
description: Attorneys of Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil and the Trump administration clashed in court over Khalil’s renewed request to be released on bail or, at least, transferred to a detention center in New Jersey to be closer to family
title: Mahmoud Khalil and Trump admin clash over new request to release or transfer him closer to family

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court on Wednesday upheld a Tennessee law restricting gender transition care for minors, delivering a major blow to transgender rights.
title: Supreme Court upholds Tennessee ban on transgender youth medical care

author: The Associated Press
description: The Indiana Pacers are preparing for the possibility of not having Tyrese Haliburton available to play in Game 6 of the NBA Finals, coach Rick Carlisle said in a radio interview on Wednesday morning.
title: Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton may miss Game 6 of NBA Finals

author: Lawrence Hurley
description: The Supreme Court on XXXX ruled for/against the authority the federal Nuclear Regulatory Commission to approve a facility in Texas to store spent fuel.
title: Supreme Court rejects challenge to federal approval of nuclear waste storage site in Texas

author: Minyvonne Burke
description: A 32-year-old man was arrested on multiple charges after a Pennsylvania teenage girl who was reported missing nearly a year ago was found alive at his North Carolina home, authorities said.
title: Man arrested after Pennsylvania teen missing for nearly a year found alive in North Carolina

author: Alexander Smith
description: Just as the streets of Tehran and Tel Aviv are strewn with debris, history is littered with cautionary tales of regime change
title: U.S.-backed regime change has a checkered past — Iran may be no different

author: Drew Weisholtz, TODAY
description: Jeremy Allen White is showing the world he does a pretty good Bruce Springsteen as he stars as the iconic singer in a new trailer for the upcoming biopic “Springsteen: Deliver Me From Nowhere.”The film “chronicles the making of Bruce Springsteen’s 1982 ‘Nebraska’ album when he was a young musician on the cusp of global superstardom, struggling to reconcile the pressures of success with the ghosts of his past,” 20th Century Studios said in a statement.“Recorded on a 4-track record
title: Jeremy Allen White is The Boss in new trailer for 'Springsteen: Deliver Me From Nowhere'

description: Watch live coverage as Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman Dan Caine testify at a Senate Armed Services Committee hearing on the Pentagon's budget request. The hearing comes amid rising tensions from the ongoing conflict between Iran and Israel.
title: Hegseth testifies at Senate budget hearing amid conflict between Israel and Iran

description: Pioneers of artificial intelligence, including Geoffrey Hinton, considered the Godfather of AI, are warning that the technology could pose a threat to workers across nearly every sector. Hinton says that without reforms in how AI is developed and implemented, there could be sharp increases in unemployment and wealth inequality. NBC’s Savannah Sellers reports for TODAY.
title: Could the Rise of Artificial Intelligence Soon Threaten Your Job?

author: Patrick Smith
description: The United States government will activate an extra 2,000 National Guard troops in Los Angeles, the military confirmed in a statement Tuesday night, as a legal battle continues over the deployment
title: 2,000 more National Guard troops on duty in L.A. as legal battle over deployment continues

description: The Federal Reserve is set to announce its next decision on interest rates with the announcement expected to carry a lot of signals on the state of the economy, inflation and consumer prices. NBC’s Christine Romans joins TODAY to break down what it means for consumers and how it may impact the economy.
title: Federal Reserve Interest Rate Decision June 2025: What to Expect

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Experts say the attacks on Iran are unlikely to lead to a regime change.
title: Interest rates unlikely to change and Sabrina Carpenter album sparks debate: Morning Rundown

description: A juror had "vertigo" and couldn't show up, the judge said. Court will reconvene on Friday.
title: Court adjourned after juror calls out sick

author: Adam Noboa
description: Artificial intelligence chat tools like OpenAI’s ChatGPT, Google’s Gemini and Microsoft’s Copilot have achieved significant public adoption, according to the latest NBC News Decision Desk Poll powered by SurveyMonkey.
title: American attitudes about AI today mirror poll answers about the rise of the internet in the '90s

author: Alexandra Marquez
description: Americans are almost evenly split on several questions measuring their views on artificial intelligence, with no meaningful differences based on age and partisanship, according to the NBC News Decision Desk Poll powered by SurveyMonkey
title: Poll: As Americans form views on AI, they're divided on its role in school and everyday life

description: Sometimes known as the “Mother of All Bombs,” the MOP weighs about 30,000 pounds and is more than 20 feet long.
title: What is the GBU-57 Massive Ordnance Penetrator, also known as the 'bunker buster'?

author: Andrew Greif
description: The Thunder will have a chance to win an NBA championship Thursday night as they take a 3-2 lead into Game 6 of the NBA Finals against the Pacers.
title: NBA Finals: Will the Thunder close out the series in Game 6?

author: The Associated Press
description: The Alabama man accused of killing 18 people in 2023 and 2024, including two mass shootings, will go to trial in April next year, a judge ruled Tuesday.
title: It may be 'very difficult' to find fair jury for man accused of killing 18 people, lawyer says

author: Peter Nicholas
description: As the conflict between Iran and Israel grows, significant parts of President Donald Trump's MAGA base are calling for the U.S. to avoid getting drawn in.
title: Amid escalating global tensions, Trump struggles to be a 'peacemaker'

author: Rob Wile
description: If the economy seems to be increasingly veering off course, the worse may be yet to come.
title: Federal Reserve set to keep interest rates steady as economic storm clouds gather

author: Aria Bendix
description: A few of the new members Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. appointed to the federal vaccine panel have promoted misinformation about vaccines and public health.
title: Kennedy's picks for vaccine advisory panel raise concerns about anti-vaccine bias

author: Dan De Luce
description: Israel says its attack on Iran could topple the regime. That's unlikely, experts say, but the strikes could shorten the lifespan of the theocratic government.
title: Will Israel's airstrikes cause the collapse of the Iranian regime?

author: The Associated Press
description: British lawmakers voted Tuesday to decriminalize abortion in England and Wales after a lawmaker argued it was cruel to prosecute women for ending a pregnancy.
title: British lawmakers vote to decriminalize abortion amid concern about the prosecution of women

author: The Associated Press
description: Spain's government said Tuesday that the massive April power outage across Spain and Portugal that left tens of millions of people disconnected in seconds was caused by technical and planning errors that left the grid unable to handle a surge in voltage.
title: Spain says April blackout was caused by grid failures and poor planning, not a cyberattack

author: The Associated Press
description: Indonesia's Mount Lewotobi Laki Laki erupted with giant ash and smoke plumes again Wednesday after forcing evacuations of villages and flight cancellations, including to and from the resort island of Bali.
title: Volcanic eruption in Indonesia forces evacuations and flight cancellations

author: The Associated Press
description: Downtown Los Angeles businesses hoped customers would return quickly on Tuesday after Mayor Karen Bass lifted a curfew she had imposed last week.
title: Los Angeles mayor lifts downtown curfew she imposed during protests against immigration raids

author: Arjun Kharpal, CNBC
description: The Trump Organization’s newly announced smartphone will most likely be made in China, experts say, despite claims that the device will be manufactured in the U.S.Owned President Donald Trump, the company on Monday announced the T1, a gold-colored device that it said would retail for $499.
title: Trump’s $499 'U.S.-built' smartphone will most likely be made in China

author: Andrew Greif
description: The Panthers won their second consecutive Stanley Cup title by outlasting the Oilers in a repeat of last year’s final.
title: Panthers defeat Oilers for second straight Stanley Cup title

author: Tim Stelloh
description: An actor and screenwriter accused Tyler Perry of sexual harassment, alleging in a lawsuit that the media mogul repeatedly made unwanted advances and sought to cover up an assault with an offer to develop a show.
title: Tyler Perry hit with sexual harassment allegations in $260 million lawsuit

author: Jonathan Dienst
description: Federal officials have apprehended one of two detainees who were still missing after their escape from an immigration detention center in New Jersey last week, the FBI says
title: Escaped N.J detainee caught, 1 more still on the run as feds double reward

author: The Associated Press
description: Applicants seeking a new passport can request a male, female or “X” marker rather than being limited to the marker that matches the gender assigned at birth.
title: Judge says Trump administration can't limit passport sex markers for many transgender, nonbinary people
